introduction.title: Introduction to Bicycle Maintenance
introduction.para: This document provides a step-by-step guide on how to properly maintain and clean a bicycle. It covers the necessary procedures, safety precautions, and required materials.

itemizedlist.listitem: Detergent C (BoeBus DeLux Detergent No.6) for specific bike models
Avoid getting degreasing agents or detergents into eyes. If contact occurs, immediately flush with clean warm water.
Use caution when handling high-pressure water hoses to avoid damaging bike components.
Point the hose away from hub and bottom bracket bearings to prevent damage.

listitem.para: Remove dirt and debris: Clean the bicycle with water to remove all dirt and debris. Refer to for guidance.
Use a stiff brush: Utilize a stiff brush to access areas that are not easy to clean, such as shift levers, knobbly tires, and brakes.
Remove caked grime: Clean the caked grime from the chain and sprockets with a screwdriver that has a small blade.
Apply degreasing agent: Remove grease from the freewheel assembly using the degreasing agent as shown in .
Use a brush: Use a brush to remove grease from parts such as sprockets, guide and tension wheels of the derailleur, and chain ring teeth.
Flush with water: Flush the sprockets, derailleurs, chain rings, and chain with water.
Lubricate the bicycle: Refer to for guidance on lubricating the bicycle.

specificProcedures.title: Specific Procedures for Different Bike Models

listitem.para: Soak sponge in Detergent A: Soak the sponge into Detergent A and water.
Clean the bicycle: Clean the bicycle with the soaked sponge.
Flush the bicycle: Flush the bicycle to remove all detergent.
Soak sponge in Detergent C: Soak the sponge into Detergent C and water.
Clean the bicycle: Clean the bicycle with the soaked sponge.
Soak sponge in Detergent A: Soak the sponge into Detergent A and water.
Fully clean the bicycle: Fully clean the bicycle with the soaked sponge.

itemizedlist.listitem: Make sure the bicycle is dry before storing or riding.

dmRef.para: Refer to for guidance on lubricating the bicycle.
